class mewbot.io.desktop_notification.DesktopNotificationOutputEngine¶

Bases: object

Cross-Platform notification shim/engine.

Works by patching the _notify function at init time to contain the correct implementation.

disable() → None¶

Disable the notification system. :return:

property enabled: bool¶
notify(title: str, text: str) → bool¶

Preform the actual notification task using the internal setup. Means we can avoid live patching externally accessible functions.

class mewbot.io.desktop_notification.DesktopNotificationOutputEvent(title: str, text: str)¶

Bases: OutputEvent

In most notification systems, you need a title and a body.

async on_member_join(member: Member) → None¶

Triggered when a member joins one of the guilds that the bot is monitoring.

async on_message(message: Message) → None¶

Check for acceptance on all commands - execute the first one that matches. :param message: :return:

async on_message_delete(message: Message) → None¶

Triggered when a message is deleted on any of the channels which the bot is monitoring. :param message: The message before the delete event occurred.

async on_message_edit(before: Message, after: Message) → None¶

Triggered when a message is edited on any of the channels which the bot is monitoring. :param before: The message before the edit :param after: The message after the edit

async on_ready() → None¶

Called once at the start, after the bot has connected to discord. :return:

mewbot.io.http module¶

When defining a new IOConfig, you need to define the components for it

  • The Input Class - here PostInput - which, here, does all the work of actually

    running the server to support post

  • The Input Event - here PostInputEvent - which is produced when an event the

    input cares about occurs - here posting to the url

class mewbot.io.http.HTTPInputListener(host: str, port: int, logger: Logger)¶

Bases: SocketInput

Runs an aiohttp microservice to allow post requests

async post_response(request: Request) → Response¶

Process a post requests to address/post

static produces_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

Defines the set of input events this Input class can produce. :return:

async run() → None¶

Fires up an aiohttp app to run the service

class mewbot.io.http.HTTPServlet(*args: Any, uid: str | None = None, **properties: Any)¶

Bases: SocketIO

Very basic IOConfig with a PostInput input - which you have to add yourself - and that’s about it.

Returns the inputs supported by the IOConfig - starting them if needed

class mewbot.io.rss.RSSInput(sites: List[str], polling_every: int, startup_queue_depth: int = 5)¶

Bases: Input

Polling RSS Input source -

async fetch_feed(url: str) → FeedParserDict¶

The actual action of fetch a feed - isolated here for easier replacement later.

property loop: AbstractEventLoop¶
async poll_site_feed(site_url: str) → None¶
property polling_every: int¶
property polling_interval: float | None¶

polling_interval is the time that the Input should wait between polling a new site. The total time between repoll of each site is polling_every.

static produces_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

Defines the set of input events this Input class can produce.

async run() → None¶

Fires up an aiohttp app to run the service. Token needs to be set by this point.

property sites: List[str]¶
async startup_site_feed(site_url: str) → None¶

Preform the first read of a site - there is some information to gather which must be stored. The requested number of events must be read and put on the wire.

state: RSSInputState¶
class mewbot.io.rss.RSSInputEvent(title: str, link: str, description: str, author: str, category: str, comments: str, enclosure: str, guid: str, pub_date: str, source: str, site_url: str, entry: FeedParserDict, startup: bool)¶

Bases: InputEvent

Should contain all the info from the original RSS message. Some normalisation might be required, as not all RSS feeds seem to correspond to the standard. Spec from https://validator.w3.org/feed/docs/rss2.html#hrelementsOfLtitemgt

class mewbot.io.rss.RSSInputEventFactory¶

Bases: object

Responsible for taking a FeedParserDict representing a new entity and transforming it into a RSSInputEvent to go on the wire.

static extract_enclosure(entry: FeedParserDict) → str¶
static extract_field(entry: FeedParserDict, attr_name: str, default: str, problem_list: List[str]) → str¶

Extract a field from an rss entry.

extract_guid(entry: FeedParserDict, site_url: str, problem_list: List[str]) → str¶

We always need some form of guid - so using a method with a fallback

extract_pubdate(entry: FeedParserDict, site_url: str, problem_list: List[str]) → str¶
class mewbot.io.rss.RSSInputState(_sites: 'List[str]', _sites_iter: 'Iterable[str]', _sites_started: 'Set[str]', _sent_entries: 'Mapping[str, Set[str]]')¶

Bases: object

check_for_event(site_url: str, site_uid: str) → bool¶

Check to see if an event is recorded as having been sent for the specified site.

note_event_transmitted(site_url: str, site_uid: str) → None¶

Record that an entry with a uid has been put on the wire. Now broken down by site so that we can more easily purge the old entries. When they have been superseded by new ones. Otherwise, they would just accumulate endlessly - a nasty memory leak.

note_site_started(site_started: str) → None¶

Record that a site has been successfully started.

property sent_entries_size: int¶
property sites: List[str]¶
property sites_iter: Iterable[str]¶
property sites_started: Set[str]¶
start() → None¶

Calculates all internal states based off _sites
